intro: Argemone arizonica, commonly known as Arizona poppy, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its vibrant orange to red flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are narrow and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often branched. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
